title: "Understanding the Significance of Eye Color in Personality Traits"
first_phrase: In the previous section, various physical traits of women were discussed, including their eye color, hair color, and the size of their forehead. In this last section, we explore the crucial interior qualities of a charming person: willpower and consciousness. Willpower distinguishes the person who fascinates from the person who is fascinated. The person who fascinates is in an active state while the person who is fascinated is in a passive state. Volition is said to be the highest mental faculty in the study of charm. It is important to note the distinction between consciousness and willpower.
content: Ojos dulces, expresivos: inteligencia acompañada a la bondad de ánimo. Ojos bien formados, de media grandeza: buena naturaleza, vista amplia, rectitud; las mujeres con tales ojos son de preferirse porque son voluntariosas, honestas y madres competentes de familia Ojos ni pequeños ni grandes: bondad de ánimo. Galeno tiene simpatía por los ojos medios, mientras asegura que aquellos que sobresalen pertenecen casi siempre a hombres de malas costumbres. ________________ 7. Dotes interiores del fascinador 1. Voluntad y conciencia Después de haber examinado los elementos físicos de la fascinación pasamos ahora a los elementos interiores. Dos de estos son fundamentales: voluntad y consciencia. Es importante distinguir entre estas dos dotes. El estado de consciencia pasiva de la persona a fascinada es un estado de consciencia, pero sin voluntad. La persona está en “observación pasiva” sin particular flujo mental. El estado de la persona que a fascina esta en vez en un estado activo. En la disciplina que estamos estudiando ahora, la voluntad está en la cima de todas las facultades mentales del hombre.
last_phrase: In conclusion, the physical features of a person, such as eye size and shape, can provide some indication of their character, but it is the inner qualities of willpower and consciousness that truly define a fascinating individual. The power of will is the pinnacle of all mental faculties, directing and guiding the mind, and must work together with the other faculties to reach its full potential. Remember, there is a clear difference between stubbornness and true willpower.
